text: Table 5. Criteria for endotracheal intubation/ICU admission 1. Signs of imminent respiratory arrest: a. Cyanosis b. Exhaustion/drowsiness c. Confusion/poor co-operation d. Silent chest c. Bradycardia . Rising PaCO, g Persistent acidosis h. Respiratory arrest 2. Poor response to initial therapy at clinic/hospital (PEF deteriorates) PaCO, = arterial blood carbon dioxide partial pressure; PEF = peak expiratory flow.
